Posts.Content: I don't know what to say, but I'm so sorry you feel so crap. I hope things settle and as you recover and become stronger you'll be like a wee butterfly emerging from a crusty old chrysalis shell, That's the best I can do but I hope it helps Sending a hug  x
Posts.Title: Big old rant!

Posts.Content: Hi Phaedra What an interesting post. How bloomin fantastic that you're literally at the end! Hurray!! I actually feel emotional for you as my run of things sounds the same as yours and I've been thinking about just the same post treatment toughts. I'm approaching FEC cycle 4 and the end seems insight now as Christmas and new year will soon be here, then rads. I was trying to plan return to work and the ifs and buts of post treatment recovery, in the night! Probably unrealistically I imagine I'll be back to normal a month after its all completed . I guess we have to let our bodies recover from the huge insult its undergone. You sound so positive and I too look on the bright side and spend a lot of the time reassuring everyone else! This will change all our lives forever, but I do feel weirdly, in a good way. I'm planning reduced working hours (I'll just spend less), to go to a festival, take more time and enjoy the things I love doing. We're so lucky to be alive :) Congratulations and happy recovery - how ever long it takes xxx
Posts.Title: Finishing treatment..

Posts.Content: After 7 weeks from the first appointment I've had the surgery and am home and tucked up in bed after day case. Much better than anticipated. Sore under me armpit and boob burning, but really ok :)  The relief and inner peace is palpable. The lead up and keeping positive and reassuring everyone was exhausting. Onward and upwards or whatever they say. Enjoying a large slice of Lemon cake and a cuppa tea.....ahh just the ticket xxx
Posts.Title: WLE and SNB, check!

Posts.Content: Thanks Pearl I'm impressed at how mobile my arm is despite the obvious pain and swelling :) Just feeling so good knowing it's not in there.  Radiotherapy for sure but don't know when. Return for results in 2/52. Always been the mention of chemo but I'll just go with the flow for the best outcome. Funny old roller-coaster, this! Amanda x
Posts.Title: WLE and SNB, check!

Posts.Content: Always keeping an eye on me! Happy Christmas lovely people. Dig in, we're getting there xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Uplifting things

Posts.Content: Good luck today HopeRu Thinking of you The haircut sounds great (and the cake). I'm day 16 post first FEC, and am having it off today as its falling out by the handful! xxx
Posts.Title: Starting chemo October!

Posts.Content: I agree! Viscotears gel is cool and so soothing for that awful sore swollen jelly eyes post treatment. Mentioned to onc at review, who prescribed.
Posts.Title: awful dry sore eyes

Posts.Content: I had FEC first cycle 9 days ago. I think everyone responds differently. I read so many accounts of how people felt after! Just make sure you're well hydrated, no expectations and report early, any concerns. Best of luck happymum, thinking of you x
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Can I join in mid month? I signed on the dotted line this afternoon, so first FEC on Monday. The Dr advised I painted my nails dark as this may help protecting them, so I went to Superdrug and had a dark plum manicure for a tenner - bargain!!! I've read so many of this forum's posts and have learnt so much, which has helped me to prepare. The BC nurses pre and post surgery were pretty useless and the onc nurse has been off sick so far.  Anyway, I'm as ready as I'll ever be..... bring it on  Night all xx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Aw, that's the first ticked off, well done Lucasjack. I'm just  a FEC girl too! I think the frozen grapes sounds a fab idea. I'm rubbish at drinking enough water so will make sure I keep extra hydrated.  Been out with good friends for blow out meal tonight and a glass or two of New Zealand sauv blanc :)  Good luck and I'll keep an eye out for your posts as we seem to be in the same boat xxx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Yay, fabulous JollyG! Just hope the other life stuff works out. There's always other stuff to worry about, which makes coping with the various treatments, side-effects and feelings a bit harder to deal with positively. Final treatment hurdle done though, now time for recovery of mind body and soul. Be kind to yourself My final zap this afternoon. I'm not sure how to feel other than a bit broken. What a long journey for us all. My (female) surgeon told me in August that we are the warriors, the strong ones and the mothers of men. I have held that thought throughout, especially in times of doubt and thinking I couldn't go on. I've enrolled on a 4 week 'Moving Forward' course, run by breast cancer care, to help with getting my life back on track. Good luck and love to all of you going through this xxxxx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hahaha Fran! Zap the bap - love it!! I had my first zap today - my bap is tingling and feels hot already. Just advised to use E45 moisturiser by team, but gently applied aloe vera gel since, taken off bra top and had some paracetamol   Good luck with yours xxx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Caz I'm using E45 before treatment and aloevera gel after. Just had my 7th zap today.  Other than a little pink my skin seems pretty good.  Hope your treatment goes well xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Yes, exactly
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Cornflakes, cornflakes and more cornflakes, morning noon and night!! They've kept me going for 2 weeks with ice-cold milk! Haven't had them since a child but that's the only lovely taste I've enjoyed :)  It is a strange culinary voyage we're all on isn't it?!
Posts.Title: Eating and drinking

Posts.Content: Aw Linsw, Hahahahha! You did make me laugh. Its just bonkers and ridiculous isn't it? Things we've never ever considered now being spoken about in an almost 'normal' way. I actually feel quite high at times as its as tho I'm talking about someone else. Whats your management plan, whats your regimen, how many hours can you work, how will you feel, when does your hair fall out, have you been to look at wigs? Arghhhh no!!!! Well today I found out the chemo starts on Monday next week and I'm seeing the oncology nurse this Friday (after numerous telephone calls to various depts). Good luck with your scans and of course the surgery. Crazy times for sure. I'm off to watch some old episodes as Father Ted seems more normal at the moment  :D   Amanda xxxx
Posts.Title: FEC it is then

Posts.Content: Thanks Cathy - 2 out of 3 weeks sounds OK I guess. I'm not going for the cold cap either - reckon I can rock a cool scarf. Interestingly the Oncologist didn't recommend it as only about 50% success rate, uncomfortable and risk of scalp cancer in the future, due to the chemo not getting to the frozen area.! You know, you're right, I think it will be liberating and exciting to see how it grows back. I guess you are post treatment now, so nice to hear from someone whose been through it and out the other side. Thanks again Wishing you well Amanda x
Posts.Title: FEC it is then

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed in June and had WLE and SNB in August. All tumour removed, clear margins and LN's but grade 3 and 24 mm. Up until this morning it has all seemed like a dream as if talking about someone else or one of my cases at the surgery (I'm a nurse practitioner). It's sinking in and I feel like a dementor has paid me a visit in the night! So first of 6 cycles to start within 2 weeks Maybe I'll sit in the corner shouting FEC! FEC! in an Irish accent...
Posts.Title: FEC it is then

Posts.Content: Hi HopeRu I hope my post didn't scare you :)  I don't have an amazing mane, so it's preservation is not high on my list, plus I'm a coward for more discomfort! I simply took the advice of the oncologist. However, she was more than happy to support me if I'd wanted to pursue the cold-cap.  I'm Day 12 - all hair intact so far - I think anytime soon it'll be on the move - I have some lovely soft cotton beanies from Amazon and have been brave (in my opinion) and booked a consultation with a hair -loss salon for a wig. Best of luck and wishing you all the best xxx
Posts.Title: FEC it is then

Posts.Content: Aw thanks LondonLass What reassuring words. It's difficult to plan work hours as its all an unknown. Do you feel different after each treatment? Does it have a sort of cumulative effect? So many questions, but all will be revealed , as you say it's a journey  - not the best, but a journey. Thanks for the gentle hug too Amanda xxx
Posts.Title: FEC it is then
